translation: (1) By the sky and the knocker
(2) And what can make you know what is the knocker?

footnotes: [1901]- Whose light pierces through the darkness.

arabic_text: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ
translation: (4) There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
(5) So let man observe from what he was created.
(6) He was created from a fluid, ejected,
(7) Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
(8) Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.
(9) The Day when secrets will be put on trial,[1902]

arabic_text: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ
translation: (10) Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.
(11) By the sky which sends back[1903]

footnotes: [1904]- With plant growth or from geological rifts.

translation: (13) Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,
(15) Indeed, they are planning a plan,
(16) But I am planning a plan.
(17) So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.[1905]
footnotes: [1905]- i.e., Do not be in haste for revenge, for you will see what will become of them.
